text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Vietnamese press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- Vietnam is considering building more facilities to house and help the nation's orphans.
-- Loose coordination among government agencies and a lack of individual responsibility hindered economic growth last year.
-- The government has banned all forms of cigarette advertising and has outlawed advertising of alcohol other than beer.
-- A Hong Kong resident has been arrested by Ho Chi Minh City Police, after being apprehended for trying to illegally bring some $45,000 worth of gold jewellery into Vietnam.
-- Vietnam's current account deficit was at double-digit levels during 1996 and the central bank has vowed to improve the current account balance in 1997.
-- The Ministry of Industry has targetted an industrial production growth rate of 15.17 percent in 1997.
-- Finance Minister Nguyen Sinh Hung says businesses hiring Vietnamese employees may be required to contribute to a proposed education and training fund.
-- Minister of Interior, Le Minh Huong, has called for measures to further strengthen the absolute and direct leadership of the Communist Party in Vietnam's police force.
-- Vietnam plans to reforest 8 million hectares (19.7 million acres) of land by the year 2010.
-- Hanoi's Communist Party Committee has reported a slowdown in economic development in the city during 1996
-- Burma's Foreign Minister Ohn Gyaw will arrive in Hanoi on Thursday to attend a three-day meeting of the joint Vietnam-Burma committee on economy, trade, science and technology
